column4: I think it says that because it should work for both 32 and 64-bit
yea thats what im thinking too. thanks
exactly, it's so much easier to control than others
I'm guessing you would have to reenable the alsa drivers for each new kernel install
in other words, whatever you did to make it work before, you have to do again for all new kernel updates
well what I did was, installed alsa-hda-dkms to get it working on 12.04, now I just updated kernel, it built a module and all. but I got no sound now the module is loaded
it built the module, but did it actually load that module?
yea snd_hda_intel is loaded right now.. just nothing shows up in aplay or alsamixer or anything else
did you try modprobe on the alsa module?
what module ? I tried rmmod snd_hda_intel and modprobing it back no luck
ack, nevermind, I'm being an idiot. Best ignore me (but not /ignore ;))
I'm guessing you already tried reinstalling the alsa thing?
did you try booting the old kernel and see if it still works there?
gonna try that in a minute, brb
yea the new kernel is Borked
not the first time that's happened, won't be the last!
yea and I got so annoyed I forgot I should just go back a kernel version.
